isNewObject
The function is used for checking the presence of an object in the database.
Returns
true
on every stage of the life cycle before the first save:
Returns an object ID by which the algorithm is calculated.
in expressions;
in life cycle algorithms before saving;
in life cycle algorithms after saving.
Syntax
currentObject
(obj)
Parameter
Purpose
obj
The object being checked.
Note
The function is called using the
button, located in ALgorithm editor on the "Sources" tab.
Examples
We need to implement an algorithm for automatic numbering of new requests to record in the "Order number" attribute. The algorithm can have the following form:
The isNewObject(currentObject()) function checks whether the current object instance is new to the System.
Several other functions are used in writing this algorithm.
See more
The
isNewObject
function is used to determine whether the current instance of the object on which the algorithm is executed is new to the System.
The condition is set using
if
and
else
operators.
If the current object is new.
sequenceNextVal
is used to return the value of the "Current value" attribute of the "Auto-numbering of order forms" object type, where the System numbers each new value.
"Auto-numbering of order forms" is an instance of the System type "Auto-numbering" [SYS_SEQUENCE] and is created in advance.
Depending on the conditions, the corresponding value is returned using the
return
function. If the current object is not new to the System, the algorithm returns the value that was calculated and recorded when creating the instance.
